website_summaries.verdict: This traditional levered toaster is simple to use and can accommodate up to 4 slices of bread at once.
pros: A Bit More, defrost, bagel and cancel options
Adjustable browning dial with LED progress bar
Option to check on toast's progress without interrupting the toasting cycle
cons: There is a section in the middle of each slot that doesn't have any heating element

customer_reviews.title: Bad reviews seems contradictory to our experience.
customer_reviews.text: We have only had this toaster for a week... so time will tell about long-term quality. So far, this is a GREAT toaster. I do not understand the bad reviews for this item, unless there is a quality problem at the factory. No sharp edges, toasts everything relatively uniformly. Would buy this again without thought. The sound for completion of the toasting cycle is not as loud as the sound of the spring mechanism tripping at the end of the toasting cycle. Update: We still love this toaster. Same quality as when it was new. We have once again found the bliss offered by great toast.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great, until it doesnt
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for months, then smoke started to appear, smelled terribly, looked inside, appeared to be something burning from behind control panel (See picture to form your own opinion) Customer service extremely difficult to work with Could not find website support since dropdown box "toaster" option was not there Website support phone number called was just placed on hold, no one ever picked up, gave up after so many minutes. Will give them another try, but wont use this toaster again Will update review if things change for the better (hopefully)
customer_reviews.author: Charles Tzipas

customer_reviews.title: This One's A Keeper!!
customer_reviews.text: You will see my reviews of 2-slice toasters scattered through Cuisinart and KitchenAid. Won't toast. Toasts very unevenly. Toasts evenly but only one side of the bread. YIKES!! Open, use, repack, return, order the next. Open, use, repack, return, order the next. The two-slice model of this Breville is a keeper!! Right out of the box toasted two slices of bread flawlessly. Bagels were perfect. My compliments to our friends in Australia for designing and building a great toaster. Also a word to the Amazon folks whose tolerance when it comes to returns has been superb. Similarly the efficiency of their system and ease of use is commendable.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Breville is the absolute worst company on earth
customer_reviews.text: I can't imagine that a toaster is a difficult piece of "equipment". Push the lever toast the bread stop when time expires. Breville can't even get the basic functionality of a toaster to work. I owned this toaster for 6 months when it stopped working. I called Breville "customer service" to see if they would replace the defective unit, after almost a 45 minute hold time no joy. Breville has no concept of the consumer, manufacture trust relationship, and the warranty is a joke if they won't stand by it. I'll never buy another Breville product and would encourage other the to do so also.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Why can't any toaster work?
customer_reviews.text: I originally gave this product a 5 star rating, now a few days later I am finding that it won't even toast bread on it's higher settings or when you press the little bit more button. I am deeply disappointed to say the least...why can't anyone make a descent toaster that actually toasts bread??? Please help me I am ready to deep six the sucker...frustration is a mild word for what I am feeling. REALLY a toaster that can't toast?!?! Pricey but seems to do the job...haven't cleaned it yet though. Looks good and I guess now a days toasters are expensive if you want them to work properly. Seems a shame they cost so much...
customer_reviews.author: Happy Chef

customer_reviews.title: Hugely disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this toaster because I had another model from the same company and it was great for almost 7 years. Unfortunately this toaster does not even come close to that one. The only thing this toaster does well is completely burn one side of the bread while not even heating the other, no matter what position i put the bread in it comes out half burnt toast and half still bread.
customer_reviews.author: JoeW

customer_reviews.title: Item was used and defective
customer_reviews.text: When unboxing the toaster, it was obvious that it had been used already. The cord was tied up messily and there were crumbs left inside. The toaster takes a really long time - the old one that it was supposed to replace is about 30% faster. On the regular setting, the inside elements don't turn on at all and the bread is only brown on one side. Yet on bagel setting the inside element turns on (and not the outside one). Would have requested a replacement but reading other reviews, it seems the toasting time is slow across the board. I expect better from Breville and Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Saendar

customer_reviews.title: Not a good choice for artisan bread
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toaster specifically for the very long slots, so that it would fit the artisan bread that I buy. Unfortunately, the Breville did a poor job with it. The crust would get very crispy (even burnt) while the middle would remain mostly untoasted. Partly this is a design flaw: there are no heating coils in the middle of the long slot. Breville expects you to toast four standard slices of bread—not a single long slice. I returned this and bought a long-slot Cuisinart, which has heating elements that go down the entire length of the toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Friedman

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a couple of weeks
customer_reviews.text: This stopped working after only using it three or four times. Customer support is terrible. They put you on hold forever. If you leave a call back number they never call you back. This was an expensive toaster and I am completely unsatisified with the customer support for this defective item.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G.

customer_reviews.title: Will not toast evenly; burnt ends and no toasting in the middle!
customer_reviews.text: toaster is very uneven in heating/toasting bread slices. ends will be burned and middle almost not toasted at all. Bad product and sorry I purchased!
customer_reviews.author: Ken Vaughan

customer_reviews.title: Not up to the standard expected from Breville
customer_reviews.text: This was the top pick on America's Test Kitchen's toaster review. I'm not sure they ever actually toasted anything with this thing. It has two wide metal bars separating each of the eight heating panels. This prevents it from toasting anything larger than standard sandwich bread. On wider slices it leaves them with an untoasted stripe. Also it's extremely slow. Had to send it back. I'm beginning to lose faith in the Test Kitchen's product reviews. This isn't the first time I've been burned by them.
customer_reviews.author: Don Bischoff

customer_reviews.title: Max toast time produces burnt sourdough bread.  Which is a good thing!
customer_reviews.text: My old toaster could not adequately brown long pieces of sourdough. So my first test for this Breville was to see if it could do better. It does. On max toast time it turned a piece of sourdough into charcoal, and I love it. So I will run more tests on lower time settings to get it just right. I like Breville stuff.
customer_reviews.author: MikeyAit

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: this is a piece of junk. It does not toast the bread on both sides equally. We have tried every combination of settings and it DOES NOT WORK. It is outrageous that this item costs $80.00. It is garbage. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth R. Herman

customer_reviews.title: $99 disappointment
customer_reviews.text: My older toaster was taking a while to "make toast" so I decided it was time to replace and why not upgrade at the same time. I did some online research and this one was in a number of the reviews. So I bit the "toast" and spent more on this toaster than I did my last microwave. I've had it a couple months and it either 1) doesn't toast enough or 2) burns the toast. I've fiddled with the sliding lever and I can't find any setting that makes good toast. Very disappointing. So i have a $99 toaster which is no better than the $20 (15 year old Target toaster) I threw away.
customer_reviews.author: Paul B

customer_reviews.title: It’s pretty, but won’t live for long
customer_reviews.text: Best part about it: easily accommodates all sizes of bread slices. What is bad about this toaster: relatively poor longevity—ours lived for about two years before failure. Also, the internal rack’s spacing allows smaller bread slices to get stuck in the toaster. We were very disappointed with this toaster; in our home, because we take care of our things, we typically get much more use for our money. .
customer_reviews.author: ReneB

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this toaster in late July of 2019. In November it just broke. The handle would not go up or down. I called and Amazon sent a replacement in December. It is now April of 2020 and the replacement toaster just stopped working. The handle wont go up or down. I'm really disappointed because this got high ratings in Consumer Reports. It has wide openings for bagels which is great. It leaks crumbs through the bottom and that's not so great. With the COVID-19 virus, I understand I probably won't get the opportunity to return it and that's okay. I just don't want anyone else wasting their money on this piece of crap toaster. SUPER disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Digital Art Professor NC

customer_reviews.title: Poor Value - Uneven Toasting
customer_reviews.text: Bread Always get darker on the inside of both slots. I've had 2 of these toasters and gave my daughter one. All had the same problem. I have sent one back to Breville and returned one. The replacement from Breville has the same problem. However, my son has the four-slice version that works great. Stay away from this two-slice toaster. This is a poor value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: John46

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes Centering Mechanism Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty disappointed in this product. It has very wide slots, but a weak mechanism for centering the bread in those slots, which means the bread slice tips over, and then the downward facing side of the bread catches the heat and gets toasted, but the upward facing side of the bread doesn't catch the heat and stays white. It's good I guess if you only ever toast really thick bread like bagels! OK if you double-check to make sure the centering mechanism is actually working each time.
customer_reviews.author: Book Buff

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 11 months - only toasts on one side - bad product quality
customer_reviews.text: This toaster worked well for a few months and then started toasting unevenly. Today, after 11 months of service, this toaster just up and quit working on one side. Now I can only make one-sided toast. For $80 I expect a toaster to last longer than a year. Avoid Breville...consumer reports was wrong about this one. My experience, and that of other purchasers (just read the reviews) reveals that this brand has poor quality. I will not purchase another Breville product again.
customer_reviews.author: M. Santos

customer_reviews.title: Cute but not functional
customer_reviews.text: I had a Cuisinart toaster for 17 years not one issue after being abused by 2 boys. I gave it to my kid and decided to get this fancy toaster for my new kitchen. What a mistake! It stopped working after a month with very little use. Of course past the return date now I have to jump through all these hoops to replace it. Too much effort for a toaster. I wish I could just return it. But it does look great.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Toasts very well. Make sure yours comes with  the manual
customer_reviews.text: Does a very nice job on toast, just perfect size for the counter not too big toasts very well. The first one I received I sent back because it didn't have a manual the alarm didn't work. Amazon immediately sent me out another one right away, and works great. Amazon sent me a printable label to put on the box, and I sent it right back I didn't have to wait for the other one, to be returned, they sent it to me right away.
customer_reviews.author: Perry

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster...but
customer_reviews.text: Breville does a great job with kitchen appliances. The four slice toaster is up to the Breville standard of quality. The only real drawback is that the bread, bagel or english muffin does not pop up and stay high enough above the top of the toaster making it difficult to remove the hot toasted item from the toaster. A bit more design work could have made this a truly excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: BenM

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in customer service who has yet to call me back after a message prompts you to leave phone number for a call back and "you wont loose your place in line". For such an expensive toaster, which has placed itself in a high end market, the fact that the toaster broke within the year AND there is no one to help remedy the issue is completely outrageous!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa N

customer_reviews.title: What a toaster should be!
customer_reviews.text: Great toaster. Kind of wished I swung for the automatic lift version for just a little more. But the bit more feature really helps if you live in a climate where the temperate changes or you refrigerate/freeze your bread sometimes. How many times where I tried to guess what a bit more should be for my bread that sat in the fridge verses when I had the same loaf at room temperature, then my bread got over cooked. Its almost like breville knows what a bit more should be. Once you use it you will know what I mean, but I think paying the extra for the auto load and eject system might be a better route.
customer_reviews.author: F/X

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it- Cheap & will not honor warranty
customer_reviews.text: The temperature control slides; it is made of pot metal. It broke after 8 weeks. ;this makes the toaster useless. It would of cost a few pennies more to make the control out of metal like a paper clip- but not; they made the most important control poorly. BIG WASTE OF MONEY. And Breville will not honor the warranty. They insist on my providing a serial number or batch number that is NOT on the Toaster. Now Breville has blocked my emails from communication with their representatives. Finally received a replacement and it broke in 2 days. Breville is ignoring my request for service on the 2nd broken toaster; fortunately Amazon is offering a full refund!
customer_reviews.author: Gregg Elberg

customer_reviews.title: Both expensive and bad at toasting
customer_reviews.text: This is a not a good toaster. Most annoyingly there are no heating elements in the center of the slots, so unless you have a very narrow piece of toast and you cram it into the end of the of the slots, you are guaranteed to get unevenly toasted toast, probably overdone on the edges and underdone in the center. Also, the slider that changes the level of doneness is not very effective. No matter where I put it, I get toast that's overdone on the edge and underdone in the center. Also, it's jarringly loud when the toast pops. I would expect to get better toast from a $25 toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for getting your toast on
customer_reviews.text: Like many of us here, you may have come here after the WireCutter review of toasters. That's what we did. We've had this toaster for about 5 months and maybe use it one or twice a week. We aren't big toasters I guess. It toasts evenly. The amount of browning seems consistent and predictable. Our toast comes out looking toasty and tasty. It's handsome enough in our modern-ish kitchen. So, yea. Nice toaster. Works well.
customer_reviews.author: R.Robot

customer_reviews.title: Works just as described, which is fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: We totally love this new toaster. First it toasts on both side of the bread (our older one did not). Second, as I've learned which settings work best with what we toast, I've used the Bit More setting to bring the toast to perfection. In a world which either cannot eat, or tries hard to avoid eating too much, not very many things in my kitchen give the simple joy of a perfectly golden piece of toast. My sister liked it for her gluten free bread, too!
customer_reviews.author: myfriendbarley

customer_reviews.title: This one's going back and my search continues for a ...
customer_reviews.text: This one's going back and my search continues for a toaster which will toast evenly on both sides of the bread. The variation from slot to slot is the same....one side of the bread done more than the other side. About a 2 shade variation. I've had cheap to expensive toasters...5 in the last 12 years.... and there doesn't seem to be a lot of difference. They've all toasted unevenly. Why is this so hard to get right?
customer_reviews.author: KenFromNorCA

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: My last $20 toaster lasted 7 years. This $140, highly rated, "pro" toaster has malfunctioned after just 18 months. Two of the four toasting elements stopped working. This was my first Breville product and will be my last. A $140 toaster should last a lifetime, literally.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High-quality toaster; one minor complaint
customer_reviews.text: This is a study, well-built toaster. We bought it based on the controls, long slots, and high reviews. The only negative is the cord storage. It is fine if you leave the toaster on the counter and want to hide excess cord, but it is a pain to use if you store it in a cabinet as we do. Nonetheless, we are very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Burt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent toaster, and beautiful, too
customer_reviews.text: Does what it is supposed to do really well. Beautiful looking, and very well made, feels substantial. I believe it is made in Australia. The features are well designed and give me all the options I need. I hit the "a bit more" button to get a perfectly toasted English muffin. Roomy slots for any size bread, I even break my big dinner rolls in half and toast them.
customer_reviews.author: netmouse

customer_reviews.title: Great if all you want is bread toasted on one ...
customer_reviews.text: Brand new out of the box and the inside heat coils do not work. Great if all you want is bread toasted on one side. Returned it immediately for a refund. Don't think I'll be purchasing anything from Breville anytime soon. Very disappointed after reading most of the positive reviews. Must say the return through Amazon is an easy process. Now will wait to see if credit is posted to my credit card.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase this toaster
customer_reviews.text: It took 3 tries to get the proper toaster as the pictures on Amazon are incorrect. Consumer Reports rated this toaster very high and I generally like Brevelle so I ordered it. 3 toasters later I got one that matched the picture and was not damaged. The long slots seem like a good idea to toast artisan bread but this is a 4 slot toaster with 4 elements and the center of the bread in the middle will not be toasted at all. The other thing is it burns on one side and doesn't toast on the other so forget this toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen S. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: VERY Short-lived Happiness
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toaster in July of 2018. Now it's December of 2019. My toaster is dead n the water. Will not pop up. Cancel button is nonfunctioning. I am very disappointed because I was sure that I had found the best toaster. I have been told that my return window ended in August. How CONVENIENT for them. $80 toasters are not supposed to die. WHAT A PIECE OF JUNK. DO NOT BUY !
customer_reviews.author: Grace Silver

customer_reviews.title: Very bad toaster for minibagels or any smaller sliced bread
customer_reviews.text: Very disapointed with the toaster , It is verry dificult to take the bread out ( we are toasting baguette bread or mini bagels) and the button “a little more “is useless cause there is no way to see how toasted is the bread, since the leveler doesnt lift high enough. Maybe i got a defective product and that’s not the way all of the toasters behave .
customer_reviews.author: william ghitis

customer_reviews.title: Ripoff
customer_reviews.text: Beware shoppers! The picture of the Breville BTA720XL is exactly the same as the BTA730XL which is really the product I thought I was ordering. The 720 is just a regular toaster; the 730 has extra long slots for homemade and artisanal breads. Do not go by the pictures! Of course there is no description or demensions for the item so you have nothing else to go on! I’ve been duped. Beware!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. Gelok

customer_reviews.title: This is probably the best toaster I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best toaster I have ever owned. The toast comes out evenly toasted on both sides. This is an extremely well thought out toaster. I particularly like where all the controls are located on the front and the lever to lower toast is on the side. Another nice feature is the ability to lift up toasted bread by raising the lever slightly, raising the toast so you don't burn your fingers reaching in to remove the toast. I normally don't write reviews, but was so impressed with this toaster I felt compelled to. Great job Breville.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine Castleman

customer_reviews.title: No better than any other toaster
customer_reviews.text: After about six months, the coils on the outside don't heat as well as the ones on the outside. It's like it's permanently stuck on "bagel". And that cute little "just a bit more" feature? That might as well be called "BURN IT!!", because that little bit more is like 2 minutes longer than the lowest setting. After six months, this $100 toaster is performing pretty much like a $10 WalMart toaster. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Paul O.

customer_reviews.title: Toaster has multiple issues
customer_reviews.text: Toaster has had several issues. While plugged in it has a consistent beep every 2-3 minutes. We have consistently have to unplug it because of the annoying beep. About 3 weeks ago the lever stopped working. We have to unplug it for the lever to stay down once it stops staying down which makes little sense to me since I figured the lever was more a mechanical function than a electric function. Overall this toaster fails. Wish we had not thrown our old toaster away. Wish we had returned within the timeline now we are stuck with a toaster that consistently beeps for no reason and a lever that works half the time.
customer_reviews.author: Holden Knight

customer_reviews.title: Really good product
customer_reviews.text: It’s solid, cleans easily, has wide slots and has a small footprint (for our galley kitchen). But just running it is different than most. We set it to bagel and from then on it only toasted one side. Well, it stays in a mode until the user hits cancel. A little confusing
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn C. Kay

customer_reviews.title: Uneven toasting
customer_reviews.text: We had a Breville toaster for 10 years and it gave up so I thought we would get another. The old toaster had even toasting with no burnt edges or untoasted middles. This toaster does both. I hate it but we will keep it for now. Wish we could get our old on back. Guessing on the slider when you need to set the toaster if you use different breads is a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Salmon Prince

customer_reviews.title: Here's a Toast to our new Toaster!
customer_reviews.text: Our old Krupp toaster had seen better days so I went on the hunt for a new one. When I saw the Breville name along with all the neat features and price point, I ordered it right away. We couldn't be happier! I just like watching the front red light display count down as the toast is getting ready to pop up. The extra wide slots make toasting bagels a breeze. The sides are barely warm even after repeated uses. It's the latest addition to our kitchen accessories.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Klyber

customer_reviews.title: Worked for only 18 Months
customer_reviews.text: We've had the toaster for 18 months. It never seemed to toast quite evenly but it was good enough and we liked the way it looked and it seemed to be a quality product. However, there seems to now be a short with the cancel button and the toast will only stay down for 10 to 20 seconds. Very disappointing for a toaster than wasn't inexpensive, and I expected more from Breville.
customer_reviews.author: Zebedee

customer_reviews.title: Fails the toasting test
customer_reviews.text: Ultimately, every toaster has one primary goal: to toast bread products evenly. Forget the bells and whistles if it fails that test. This toaster fails it. If you put wide slices in (the reason we bought it), the ends burn before the middle section is even a light tan in color. So, if cutting away the sides of your toast is your idea of a fun game in the morning, this is the toaster for you. Otherwise, make a different choice. We are returning this overpriced and underperforming toaster.
customer_reviews.author: David Lyon

customer_reviews.title: Toasts uniformly and easy to adjust!
customer_reviews.text: I wish the crumb tray were a bit more rigid as it feels flimsy and I worry it will break. I particularly like the “bit more” button when it is quite done enough. It could be a bit wider as if I don’t cut my bagel exactly perfectly in half one side won’t fit. But it toasts very well and uniformly. Overall I am very happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Toaster
customer_reviews.text: Great Toaster, my toast, bagel and pop tarts come out prefect every time. I love this toaster!! I didn't want to spend this much money on a toaster, but I am so happy I did. You don't need to push the toast back down again to finish toasting it or in so cases burning it. You select were you think you might like it set. I have yet to burn it, and I like my toast, Toasted good. I give this toaster A+++++++++
customer_reviews.author: Helen Bough

customer_reviews.title: Uneven toasting.
customer_reviews.text: You had one job to do ! Uneven toasting dead zone in the middle of the slot. Looks like two normal sized heating elements with a gap between them. The other reviews are correct. Does not lift small toast very high. Plus side bagel toast function works if you kind the gap.
customer_reviews.author: HoHum

customer_reviews.title: Great Toaster
customer_reviews.text: Love this toaster... Replaced my Cuisinart toaster with this unit and am very happy with the change. Does a great job on both bagels and toast...❤ Don't believe the bad reviews, especially the one from the lady with the cut hand. The inside of the toaster around the top, is not razor sharp. Anything is possible but why you would reach inside a hot toaster, is beyond me, anyway? Besides it has an extra lift feature that raises the toast for easy extraction...
customer_reviews.author: Helena Helm Lyons

customer_reviews.title: Uneven, avoid
customer_reviews.text: Does not toast bread evenly on both sides. Inner side (regardless of slot) is always lighter. Breville customer service says this is a feature, not a defect!?!? Returned for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Breville toaster oven purchased and both of them broke much too soon. The latest one only lasted two months. The spring breaks. Too bad - I love it’s design and features but I’m cured, I’ll buy a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful but Bad
customer_reviews.text: While this toaster is aesthetically pleasing, the temperature control is erratic. You often end-up burning the edges of the bread, and leaving the center untoasted. It also looks as if several of the heating elements don't work. This toaster is expensive, good looking, but the quality control on functionality seems to be nonexistent.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Nilsson

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!  WASTE OF MONEY!!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!! WASTE OF MONEY!!! After only having this toaster for 6 weeks the inside elements stopped working except in bagel mode. I called the manufacturer 12 different times and after being in hold for more than 30 minutes each time I was hung up on. I emailed them and never received a response. When looking at the reviews on the Breville website I saw that this is a problem this model has had for quite some time. $80 for a toaster that doesn't work in less than 2 months....revolting!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, even toast and nice features without being too complicated.
customer_reviews.text: Makes good toast that is even on each side. The 'bit more' button is handy, especially if you have the dial set for one type of bread and you're doing something else like pita. I noticed the coils on the inside don't glow like the ones on the outside, but this does not seem to affect the cooking. It might be due to the center coil being shared by both sides. Looks great too.
customer_reviews.author: CJS

customer_reviews.title: Inside heating elements won't heat to red glow, inside of toast is under cooked & outside perfect.
customer_reviews.text: We purchase this toaster about a year ago. I love the looks of the toaster and several of the key features. But at the end of the day, a toaster simply must toast evenly and sadly this one does not. I did not realize how badly it toasted until we spent the weekend with College couple we have know for 35 years. They have a different high end toaster. It really brought the issue to light. I am going to reach out to Breville, and see if they will give me a credit to trade up to a different model.
customer_reviews.author: Lawprof

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this toaster for only a few days and I am amazed at how well it works. I have only used it for bagels and English muffins so far but they have turned out perfectly. The toasting is very even and I love the "little more" feature. I haven't mastered the settings yet but I will in time. I am upset with myself that I haven't bought this before. Consumer Reports gave it a 5/5 rating - the only toaster that got that ranking. Now I'm starting to know why. Definitely worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: jeanne frank

customer_reviews.title: Best ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: We have owned this for about 15 months. It is used everyday. There is nothing that I dislike about this product. It works well every time. No problems with the popup. Some people said it pops out of the toaster. NEVER had this problem. Makes great bagels toast, waffles everytime. Fits artisan breads with ease. I spent easily 6 or more hours researching toasters. This is IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra D. Snitz

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well. Toasts nicely
customer_reviews.text: I had this model for a few years with no problem. The part that the toast sits on finally broke so I bought a replacement toaster. This one worked for 4 days until the lever that pushes the toast down ceased to stay down. I had to return. Maybe the one I got was defective. There aren’t too many options out there for long slot toasters.
customer_reviews.author: VioletGrandma

customer_reviews.title: Was this a new item?
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with the toaster but it arrived in it's original box without the warranty or information booklet that should have been in the package. I can't warranty it against defects without the information that should have been there. What do I do now? This has never happened before. Also the box had been sprayed with some powder so I had to throw it out. The toaster was in a protective plastic bag so it seemed to be fine so I kept it.
customer_reviews.author: JOYCE H OATFIELD

customer_reviews.title: Good toaster, but was expecting more.
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it for toast and it works very well for standard size bread, however I bought it thinking it could accommodate wide bread slices that I typically use for toast. Unfortunately, it is not deep enough and as a result I have to manually turn the bread during the toasting process. The functional performance of this toaster is not an issue, but the design does not fit my needs.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Best toaster I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: I could never bring myself to spend this much money on a toaster. That led to numerous inexpensive toasters that did not last long and did not toast evenly. This toaster toasts perfect every time and offers flexibility to toast just a little more by the push of a button! I don't think I will need another toaster now!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lacking longevity
customer_reviews.text: After using my sister's Breville toaster, especially loving the "bit more" feature, I finally bought my own "bit more" version in late 2017. Less than 3 years later, the heating elements along both sides of the middle section are no longer functioning. I now have to flip my bread around for it to be toasted on both sides. I loved this toaster, when it worked.
customer_reviews.author: just sayin'

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was top rated by Consumer Reports. It isn’t cheap, but the product isn’t made cheaply either. Our last toaster stopped toasting on both sides after just a couple of months of use so I am very happy with this one. It’s nice looking, easy to use, and even has a nice feature of being able to toast “ A bit more .” I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: I love my Puggle

customer_reviews.title: Toasts Evenly
customer_reviews.text: Finally a reasonably priced toaster that toasts bread evenly. This toaster has more toasting coils that are closer together to allow better and evener browning.
customer_reviews.author: fz

customer_reviews.title: Got a lemon
customer_reviews.text: Received toaster on 2/2. Noted uneven toasting (center panel not heating up more that ~10% visibly). Toaster was not set to bagel. For this price I would expect better. Will attempt to exchange. I have had very good experiences with many other Breville appliances.
customer_reviews.author: Carisa & Bjorn

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful! Can’t go wrong with Breville!!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful toaster!! I’ve done regular bread and English muffins in it, and they have all come out toasted evenly on both sides. It takes a bit of finagling to find the right setting but, after that’s mastered, all breads are toasted to perfection. Very happy with this!! I have other items from Breville, and each one lives up to my expectations. Very good company with excellent products.
customer_reviews.author: Angie T.

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: well it does not toast even on the first time you use it and for the money you would think thats the first thing it would do other then that it works ok
customer_reviews.author: Lee Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Freakin awesome
customer_reviews.text: Saw this on America's Test Kitchen and it lives up to the hype. I didn't realize how much I appreciate consistency in successive toasting. With other toasters there was the usual crap of having to pull the second set of toast out early due before it burned, but not anymore! I also really appreciate seeing how much longer the toast has before completion. We haven't even needed to use the "Bit More" button since we have the dial exactly where we want it.
customer_reviews.author: David Flemming

customer_reviews.title: Broken in exactly a year.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in July of 2018. Decided to spend extra money for a toaster that would last longer. The handle no longer stays down in July of 2019. Took apart, it wasn't any dirt. Electronics broke. Piece of overpriced junk.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Rubin

customer_reviews.title: As advertised, read the reviews!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as advertised, great product, great features! I love that you can interrupt toasting to check the bread/bagel so it doesn’t burn. The only negative is how hot the sides get. WAY too hot!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: One of the best toasters out there
customer_reviews.text: A well designed, and truly one of the best toasters out there. True, not cheap, but produces some of the best bagels and toast ever. It counts down, tells you when your toast is done and you can check while your toast is being toasted if it needs a little more time. The heating elements are controlled by an "on board" computer. All toasters should be so good! Had I known would have bought a Breville years ago! Yes, its that good
customer_reviews.author: James W. Murray

customer_reviews.title: Nice solid toaster
customer_reviews.text: After TONS of reading articles and reviews we decided to try this one and we really like it. I like that it feels solid, not flimsy, it really does stay cool to touch when toasting, and does toast well. I'm fine with spending a little more for a solid product.
customer_reviews.author: BarbW

customer_reviews.title: We like it so far
customer_reviews.text: New purchase. We like it so far, still adjusting our toasting preferences. Very nice to look at, does fit the larger bagels. The digital is rather cool to watch, have always had regular toasters. The toast and bagels are hot when they come out, which I like, but the outside of the toaster does not get hot. Would purchase again at this time. If any problems I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: larwis

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Value for a Breville Toaster
customer_reviews.text: This is a great value for a normally expensive brand toaster. It works very well, and looks nice. I think the only thing negative I can say about it is that the stainless steel casing has little dimples and waviness when you look at it from the side. My previous Breville toaster that costed more than twice the price of this one had a better fit and finish of the stainless steel casing.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Knob snapped off second day
customer_reviews.text: Overall we liked the toaster, but after only two days the plastic darkness knob snapped off. Makes me suspicious of other cheaply designed elements on the toaster. For the price, we expect better design and component quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: awesome toaster
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why some others have written negative reviews. This toaster is great. Outside cover stays cool, temperature settings are easy to set and consistent., toast is evenly toasted, not sure what else one can expect from a toaster. A little pricey but considering all of the above I would give it a big thumbs up. Great product Breville.
customer_reviews.author: MikeLA

customer_reviews.title: It toasts!
customer_reviews.text: This product had great reviews, so expectations were high. We found it difficult to determine the setting that was best because it varies a bit. We will continue to use it, but it was not as good as we expected. We do like the "A bit more" feature.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bell

customer_reviews.title: 4th toaster, most expensive toaster purchased to date, ...
customer_reviews.text: 4th toaster, most expensive toaster purchased to date, not sure what's up with toasters these days, but they are awful. This one burns the edges, on #2 setting, and leaves the bagel cold in the middle, and burns the edges on #2 setting of plain toast. Maybe the manufacturers are trying to get toaster to do to much. Sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: cow

customer_reviews.title: Toaster Doesn't Work Properly
customer_reviews.text: By far, the worst toaster I have ever purchased. Toasts unevenly, burns on one side. Not worth the money and Breville needs to take this one off the market. Returned the first one and replaced with exact same model thinking the first one was defective... it was not. It's just this particular model.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Lever broke after 8 months.
customer_reviews.text: If it weren't for a responsive customer service at Breville and a replacement 8 months after purchase, we would have given this a one star only. The product is way too expensive for the quality given. While the extra features are nice to have, the basic function - browning - is uneven, which for a $80 toaster is unacceptable. Then after almost 8 months the lever broke after light (!) use: once a day for toast in the am. The $20 toaster we had before didn't look as nice but surely did a better job for entire 4 years. Functions should come first, design second. They put too much focus on design w this item.
customer_reviews.author: NaAm

customer_reviews.title: Don't burn your "bread" by spending it on a lesser quality appliance.
customer_reviews.text: This thing died fairly quickly leaving me very sad because it was my third new toaster in 6 months. I was especially sad in that, after the 2nd failure, I decided to purchase a big-buck toaster. Well, it's true what they say, "You really do get what you pay for." What I mean is, I called Breville, and had a brand new toaster -- with a brand new warrenty. The replacement has worked flawlessly! Love this company!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Gallimore

customer_reviews.title: The versatility is amazing! In a toastier!
customer_reviews.text: This toaster absolutely makes toast any way you want it and is one of the best kitchen products I have ever purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Toater pictured is not the toaster described
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was buying a long slot toaster based on the picture but it is not. If I would have read the dimensions they were correct. The large print giveth and the small print taketh away.
customer_reviews.author: sean okamoto

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Looks great and works well. My daughters toaster waffles have never been more tasty. Makes a large mechanical noise when the toast is done - which is good that it lets you know but it startles us.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Perlson

customer_reviews.title: I love the three different buttons and the lighted strip that ...
customer_reviews.text: I researched this product thoroughly on the net and found it got rave reviews for quality and price. Since using it, I have confirmed the reviews. The "raise to check browning" feature is fabulous. The bagel button focuses the heat in the center for smaller items. I love the three different buttons and the lighted strip that shows the progress. The stainless steel is beautiful. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Astroguy

customer_reviews.title: Now the best Breville as to offer...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this toaster based on the recommendation of America test kitchen. They have never proved us wrong until now. The toaster doesn’t toast evenly, you have to rotate the toast midway in order for them to toast properly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SLOW!
customer_reviews.text: Had this for about two years and it is by far the SLOWEST toaster ever. You can start a fire with a rock and flint and make a loaf of bread in a rock oven by the time you'll get your two toasted slices. Otherwise it looks nice...
customer_reviews.author: Eddie S

customer_reviews.title: After a bad experience with an OXO toaster
customer_reviews.text: After a bad experience with an OXO toaster, we settled on this and are happy we did! Does what it's supposed to... toast bread... and looks good doing it! We liked the quality so much that when our OXO coffeemaker crapped out, we replaced it with a Breville we LOVE!
customer_reviews.author: Pat In NYC

customer_reviews.title: 6 mos old and it stopped working
customer_reviews.text: We were excited about getting a quality named toaster and are so disappointed that it has stopped working after only 6 mos of using it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan McDaid

customer_reviews.title: 2 slice Toaster
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed in this toaster, I had looked at the reviews and thought I would work for me, but I was not happy with the way it toasted, did not toast even.
customer_reviews.author: lewilc

customer_reviews.title: Great look Great perfomance
customer_reviews.text: I like the design and I especially like that the controls are on the side of this toaster. Controls for adjusting toast and functions are easy to see and the toaster works very well . . . . we love it
customer_reviews.author: Richard G.

customer_reviews.title: Slots/Clean Out
customer_reviews.text: The prongs that the bread sits on don't go out far enough....bread slide past the prongs making it difficult to remove from toaster. The pop-up doesn't come up far enough to remove eggos or english muffins...had to use a utensil to remove. The cancel button does not stop and pop up breads either. If there is a door for a clean out, I wasn't able to find it or open it. Never thought I'd hate a toaster as much as I do this one!
customer_reviews.author: learner 1

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this toaster.
customer_reviews.text: One side of the toaster works fine. The other size toasts one side of the bread and only warms the other side. Looking for another toaster.
customer_reviews.author: MikeV

customer_reviews.title: the bit more feature is worth it
customer_reviews.text: So what do you do if your toast isn't quite dark enough? Not with this toaster-push a button and cooks a bit longer, does bagels and frozen bread, I keep mine in freezer. All comes out perfect. Sure, not cheap but was replacing toasters constantly. This one should last a while.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Dann

customer_reviews.title: Well designed
customer_reviews.text: This is a really well thought out and designed toaster. The two long openings allow you to toast up unusually large slices (like sourdough) or four slices of regular toast. Also handles bagels. It also looks good sitting on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: MV

customer_reviews.title: Specs listed are incorrect
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 720 XL listed as 12.5 by 9 by 9. Mine is 10.5 by 8 by 6.5; not the extra long one I ordered. I checked the model listed on the toaster and it indeed said it was the 720xl. I hesitate to order again since there's obviously a problem at the factory. I also got it apparently re-packaged since the box was torn and scotch taped together. The toaster though was apparently new. I will return but not sure how to get what I had ordered in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy B.

customer_reviews.title: Best toaster ever!
customer_reviews.text: Finally a toaster that makes perfect toast. I like my toast more toasted than my husband. This toaster makes my husband’s blond toast perfectly and then makes my brown toast without burning it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Story

customer_reviews.title: Great, then not so great.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased only 3 years ago it’s already starting to break. We were super happy with it until recently. The lever that you press to push down the toast is now refusing to stay down. Useless.
customer_reviews.author: Christoph

customer_reviews.title: Best ever long slice toaster!!
customer_reviews.text: This toaster really does long slice bread right! There is no confusion with a bagel setting, just great toast on both sides. It also has the greatest plug I have ever used-I wish all small appliances had plugs with that shape, ease of use and sturdiness. It is well made and I am sure will last for years. Thank you Breville
customer_reviews.author: DGB

customer_reviews.title: Shipped without outer box
customer_reviews.text: This toaster was shipped to me without an outer box. When I opened it, it appeared fine, but I noticed a dent on the back later on. I have only used the toaster once so far, and it seemed pretty easy to use and toasts evenly. If you want to purchase this, I would not recommend purchasing on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Janny

product_meta.title: Breville BTA720XL The Bit More 2-Slice Toaster
product_meta.description: Model Number:BTA720XLHow do you perfectly toast any slice no matter what type of bread? Add an extra 30 seconds for well that little bit more. The Breville BTA720XL Bit More toaster also features a 'Lift & Look' Lever which raises and lowers the carriage to show the browning progress without interrupting the toasting cycle. Additionally, the high lift feature raises the carriage approximately a 1/2 inch making it easier to remove smaller items such as English Muffins.
feature_bullets: 2 slice full stainless steel body toaster
Voltage:110 - 120 volts.A Bit More' allows you to add a little extra time to the toasting cycle
Lift & Look' lever to check your toast at any time without interrupting the toasting cycle
Other settings include Bagel, Frozen and Cancel buttons.Power: 900 Watts
Adjust the toast ready alert to High, Low or Mute

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars1,657 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
